resources.string:
Starting GoIV for the first time:

Enter your trainer info.

Press the GRANT PERMISSION button and accept all prompts.

Press start.
Use the slider below to align the arc:
Launch the game when GoIV is started
Show a screen which allows you to manually edit the scanned information before showing results
Save battery life by scanning screenshots instead of auto detecting. This setting has to be enabled for Android KitKat and below. Warning! In this mode the GoIV button does not auto appear
Automatically delete screenshots taken by GoIV
Add information to your copy & paste clipboard on full pokemon scan (Press the button).
Help the developers improve the application by sending anonymous crash-related information to them and completely anonymous usage stats
Automatically check for updates when the app is being used
See if an update is available
Scanning failed, please scroll up and try again!
Power up and evolution calculation\nDrag the level slider to view different predictions
Something went wrong! Please check that the input values were correct, and that GoIV has the right trainer level in the launch screen.
An error occurred while checking for an update. Please check your internet connection
An update for GoIV is already being downloaded
The \% shows the difference between your monster and a one that\'s 15/15/15.\n\nThe number in parenthesis is how much CP is loses compared to a 15/15/15.
Show how many you can evolve
This feature enables scanning for candy amount and allows you to see how many monsters you can evolve, useful for use with lucky egg
Drag the window by this handler to relocate it.
Please choose a token to add from the scrollable list.
Automatically expand the full appraisal checkbox menu
Display translated monster name on GoIV but use its English name for OCR. This is for when the game app is in English but user\'s native language is not
Allows you to define another setting for Copy to clipboard in Edit which will show a different result when a scan returns a single possibility.
Allows you to define another setting for Copy to clipboard in Edit which will show a different result when a scan returns a 100% result.
View application credits, used open source projects and thanks

GoIV has detected that your phone does not have the MediaProjection API, which is used to automatically show the IV scan button. This might be fixed by updating your phone to Android 5 or above. The app will lock itself to screenshot mode to avoid crashing. You can use GoIV by manually triggering a screenshot, which most devices does by holding home+power for a short duration. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Show a preview of what is copied to the clipboard in a small popup
How long to wait for the appraisal text animation to end. Budget phones might need a 800 ms delay.
Display a small preview automatically when on a \'mon screen
On a quick iv scan, also show a small popup previewing the smart-clipboard
Recalibration enhances GoIV\'s performance by dynamically finding optimal scan locations for your phone.
You have not run scan calibration. It\'s recommended to run this optimization on all devices.
GoIV has detected that your screen is not standard. You\'ll most likely need to perform screen calibration for GoIV to work.
Your calibration data is outdated. Please run screen calibration again to enjoy the latest features!
"GoIV needs to access external storage to share the calibration screenshot with your email client app."
There are unsaved changes.\nDo you really want to discard them?
Configuration saved!\nPlease enable \"%1$s\" feature in setting to activate the new configuration!
%1$s This token is a max evolution variant, meaning that it will return a result as if your monster was already fully evolved, which might be more interesting in a lot of cases.
Please fill in your custom separator
Custom separator can\'t contain . because the developer is lazy
Full list of available token types
"The next screenshot taken will be used to recalibrate GoIV!"
This is the result of the automatic calibration, each field of interest that was detected has been marked.
Before saving, check the result correctness in the screenshot below:
Unable to locate power up stardust cost\n
Unable to locate power up candy cost\n
Unable to locate level arc center\n
Unable to compute level arc radius\n
Unable to locate white marker pixel\n
Unable to pick white marker pixel color\n
Unable to locate green marker pixel\n
Unable to pick green marker pixel color\n

ATTENTION! Please verify that:
① The info screen is scrolled all the way up
② The 3D model doesn't cover any important information
③ Is not a final evolution! I suggest a Pidgey!
④ Is not lucky
Calibration saved!\nRestart GoIV to apply the changes!
Finding power up stardust cost area
Finding power up candy cost area
Finding level arc starting point and radius

This token gives you the base stats of the monster, such as 186 190 260 for lapras, which means that this monster without IV bonuses has 186 attack, 190 defense and 260 stamina. IVs can add an extra 15 to each stat.
" This version of the token also adds the IV score so you can see the total for this specific monster."
" This specific version of the token only displays one of the stats."
Get how much CP the monster has at the current level.
Get how much CP the monster will have at max level.
Get how much CP the monster will be missing compared to a perfect IV level 40 variant.
Returns a percentage expressing how many other possible permutations of IVs are better than this monster\'s IVs. The smaller the result is, the better it is.

This token gives you an idea of how powerful this monster can become, by measuring the maximum possible CP the monster can obtain. So for example, A lapras can max out at 2980 CP, while a dugtrio would max out at 1168 CP. So Lapras would get A while Dugtrio would get E-. This tier is adjusted based on the IV of your monster.
This lets you pick a character of you choice to be put in between the smarter tokens to make the result more readable.

This token gives you an idea of how powerful this monster can become, by measuring the maximum possible CP the monster can obtain (considering the maximum possible IV from the scan) and confronting it to the maximum CP of the most powerful IV 100 monster. Values are provided in the AA-ZZ range.
Represents the monster IVs in a base 16 number system. This means that each IV can be represented by a single character. So for example, a monster with IVs 10, 13, 3 would be represented as AD3.
Get how much HP the monster has at the current level.
Get how much HP the monster will have at max level.

" percent of the IV possibilities. If only one iv combination is possible, minimum, average and maximum will be the same. For example, if the iv range is 55–75, the minimum will return 55, the average will return something between 55 and 75, and the maximum will return 75."
"This token returns the sum of the "
" possible IV stats for this monster. Ranges in 00–45. Always returns two digits."

This token represents the level of the monster, as it was scanned, times 2. This avoids decimals, which makes the text longer, but does not lose information like removing the decimal does. For example, if the monster is level 10.5, this will return 21.
This token represents the level of the monster, as it was scanned, but removes the decimal. This potentially loses information. For example, a level 10.5 monster will return 10.

This token represents the level of the monster, as it was scanned, including the decimal. This makes the output longer than the alternatives, but is very accurate. For example, a level 10.5 monster will return as 10.5.
This token shows the level of the monster as one or two unicode tokens, the first to show the whole level such as ⑰, and if the monster is half-leveled, also adds a ½.
Similar to UIV, UNICODE circular numbers are used to represent IV.

" This token uses filled characters to represent single values and empty characters to represent the lowest of multiple values. For example, ⓭ in the attack position would mean that all Attack values are 13, while ① in the defense or HP means there are multiple values possible and that 1 is the lowest."

" This token uses empty characters to represent single values and filled characters to represent the lowest of multiple values. For example, ⑪ in the attack position would mean that all Attack values are 11, while ❾ in the defense or HP means there are multiple values possible and that 9 is the lowest."

This token calculates how close your monster is to its max potential, measured by CP. For example, if a monster with max IVs maxes out at 2000cp, but your specific monster maxes out at 1900, then your monster perfection is 95%, so this token returns 95.
"This token returns the gender of the monster: %1$s if male, %2$s if female, empty otherwise.
"This token returns the name of the monster, for example if you scan a Dratini, it will return "
" With the number cap, the length of the monster name can not exceed "
"This token returns an initial for each word in the fast and charge moves (%1$d each, using _ as filler), for example if you scan a Venusaur with %2$s and %3$s, it will return %4$s."
Show how many power-ups are left until monster would reach level 40. For example if the monster is level 15, there are 25 levels to level 40, which is 50 powerups.
"This is simply a character you can put in between the smarter tokens to make the result more readable. The character you have chosen is: "
This token gives you a representation for your monster IVs, but using UNICODE special characters which allows you to show numbers like 11 as a single character, like ⑪. This saves space.
" This token is the filled version, which has a black inside for the numbers, like ⓭."
" This token is the empty version, which has a white inside for the numbers, like ⑪."

"This token returns an evaluation of how worth it is to train this monster, based both on the base stats and the %1$s possible IV stats. For instance, a 96%% IV Alakazam will get a score higher than a 20%% Tyranitar, regardless the fact that the maximum possible CP for the latter is higher: since the probability of getting better Tyranitar is higher than the one of getting better Alakazams, the second represents a much better stardust investment. Ranges in 00–99. Always returns two digits."
"Get the difference in percentage between the maximum and the perfect IV combination. For example, if the max IV combination percentage is 97, this token will return 03."
If GoIV failed recalibrating when it should have worked, please press the button below to generate an automatic bug report email.

"Score based on data from pokebattler.com simulations.
Simulations are on gym battles, raids often have other optimal movesets.
Optimal moveset can change in certain matchups.
This score is only a guideline."
"Pokémon data added to clipboard.\nPaste it in at the import screen."
"Added %1$s to the export queue.\nYou currently have %2$d pokémon cached."

"If automatic calibration fails, you can manually edit the scan fields. Sorry. This feature is in beta, if automatic calibration works for you, it's most likely better to not bother manually changing it."
"You can drag this window up and down if it's in the way."
